title: Cowboy Copas - Settin' Flat On Ready - Bear Family CD (2008)
description:
Cowboy Copas - Settin' Flat On Ready - Gonna Shake This Shack Tonight - Bear Family CD (2008)


With his unique blend of honky-tonk, Western swing, country boogie, and proto-rockabilly, Cowboy Copas was a huge influence on everyone from Johnny Cash to Waylon Jennings. SETTIN' FLAT ON READY captures Copas at his finest, from the Leadbelly-goes-Nashville chug of "Alabam" to the (literal) gallows humor of the shuffling "Hangman Boogie." With 34 songs and a 40-page booklet, this collection makes the ideal introduction to Copas's work. 

2008 release coinciding with the 45th Anniversary of this Country star's death. With a career dating back to the late '30s, Lloyd 'Cowboy' Copas was one of country music's great stylists. After signing with King Records in 1946, Copas rose to prominence with a string of hit singles, his distinctive high baritone voice grabbing nickels in jukeboxes across the Southeast and Midwest. Though most of his records were pure, unadulterated Country, Copas showed a versatility that few singers could match. He recorded with Elliot Lawrence's big band and later cut some edgy Rockabilly. This single-disc collection culls the best of Copas's upbeat tracks for King, along with scarce material from his short-lived stints with Dot. 34 tracks. Bear Family
